card.title: Card Request
card.description:
The payment card to use to fund a payment. Can be a credit or debit card.
Note: Passing card number, cvv and expiry directly via the API requires PCI SAQ D compliance.
*PayPal offers a mechanism by which you do not have to take on the PCI SAQ D burden by using hosted fields - refer to this Integration Guide*.

name.description: The card holder's name as it appears on the card.

number.description: The primary account number (PAN) for the payment card.

expiry.description: The year and month, in ISO-8601 `YYYY-MM` date format. See [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

security_code.description: The three- or four-digit security code of the card. Also known as the CVV, CVC, CVN, CVE, or CID. This parameter cannot be present in the request when `payment_initiator=MERCHANT`.

billing_address.description: The portable international postal address. Maps to [AddressValidationMetadata](https://github.com/googlei18n/libaddressinput/wiki/AddressValidationMetadata) and HTML 5.1 [Autofilling form controls: the autocomplete attribute](https://www.w3.org/TR/html51/sec-forms.html#autofilling-form-controls-the-autocomplete-attribute).
billing_address.title: Portable Postal Address (Medium-Grained)

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address, such as number and street, for example, `173 Drury Lane`. Needed for data entry, and Compliance and Risk checks. This field needs to pass the full address.

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address, for example, a suite or apartment number.

admin_area_2.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than `admin_area_level_1`.

admin_area_1.description:
The highest-level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision. This data is formatted for postal delivery, for example, `CA` and not `California`. Value, by country, is:
  • UK. A county.
  • US. A state.
  • Canada. A province.
  • Japan. A prefecture.
  • Switzerland. A *kanton*.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the ZIP code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

country_code.description:
The [2-character ISO 3166-1 code](/api/rest/reference/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

attributes.title: Card Attributes
attributes.description: Additional attributes associated with the use of this card.

customer.title: Card Customer Information
customer.description: The details about a customer in PayPal's system of record.

allOf.title: Customer Information
allOf.description: This object represents a merchants customer, allowing them to store contact details, and track all payments associated with the same customer.

id.description: The unique ID for a customer generated by PayPal.

email_address.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.

phone_number.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).
phone_number.title: Phone

national_number.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

given_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.

surname.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.

merchant_customer_id.description: Merchants and partners may already have a data-store where their customer information is persisted. Use merchant_customer_id to associate the PayPal-generated customer.id to your representation of a customer.

vault.title: Vault Instruction Base
vault.description: Basic vault instruction specification that can be extended by specific payment sources that supports vaulting.

store_in_vault.description: Defines how and when the payment source gets vaulted.

x-enumDescriptions.description: Defines that the payment_source will be vaulted only when at least one authorization or capture using that payment_source is successful.

verification.title: Card Verification
verification.description: The API caller can opt in to verify the card through PayPal offered verification services (e.g. Smart Dollar Auth, 3DS).

method.description: The method used for card verification.

x-enumDescriptions.description: Selecting this option will attempt to force a strong customer authentication for the authorization/transaction. In countries where SCA has been defined and implemented it will result in a contingency and HATEOAS link being returned.  The API caller should redirect the payer to that link so that they can authenticate themselves against their issuing bank or other entity. As noted, the HATEOAS link is only available in all regions where strong authentication is supported, (e.g. in European countries where 3DS is live). Merchants can use this setting as an additional layer of security if they choose to. In all cases, when an authorization is requested the AVS/CVV results will be returned in the response.

This is the default. When an authorization or transaction is attempted this option will return a contingency and HATEOAS link only when local regulations require strong customer authentication, (e.g. 3DS in countries and use cases where it is mandated). The API caller should redirect the payer to the link so that they can authenticate themselves. In all cases, when an authorization is requested the AVS/CVV results will be returned in the response.
The contingency surfaced as an additional security layer that helps prevent unauthorized card-not-present transactions and protects the merchant from exposure to fraud.

Places a temporary hold on the card to ensure its validity. This process protects the merchant from exposure to fraud. This verification method will confirm that the address information or CVV included matches what the issuing bank has on file for the associated card, ensuring that only authorized card users are able to make purchases from you.

vault_id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the vaulted payment source. This ID should be stored on the merchant's server so the saved payment source can be used for future transactions.

single_use_token.description: The PayPal-generated, short-lived, one-time-use token, used to communicate payment information to PayPal for transaction processing.

stored_credential.title: Card Stored Credential
stored_credential.description:
Provides additional details to process a payment using a `card` that has been stored or is intended to be stored (also referred to as stored_credential or card-on-file).
Parameter compatibility:
  • `payment_type=ONE_TIME` is compatible only with `payment_initiator=CUSTOMER`.
  • `usage=FIRST` is compatible only with `payment_initiator=CUSTOMER`.
  • `previous_transaction_reference` or `previous_network_transaction_reference` is compatible only with `payment_initiator=MERCHANT`.
  • Only one of the parameters - `previous_transaction_reference` and `previous_network_transaction_reference` - can be present in the request.

payment_initiator.description: The person or party who initiated or triggered the payment.

x-enumDescriptions.description: Payment is initiated with the active engagement of the customer. e.g. a customer checking out on a merchant website.
Payment is initiated by merchant on behalf of the customer without the active engagement of customer. e.g. a merchant charging the monthly payment of a subscription to the customer.

payment_type.description: Indicates the type of the stored payment_source payment.

x-enumDescriptions.description: One Time payment such as online purchase or donation. (e.g. Checkout with one-click).
Payment which is part of a series of payments with fixed or variable amounts, following a fixed time interval. (e.g. Subscription payments).
Payment which is part of a series of payments that occur on a non-fixed schedule and/or have variable amounts. (e.g. Account Topup payments).

usage.description: Indicates if this is a `first` or `subsequent` payment using a stored payment source (also referred to as stored credential or card on file).

x-enumDescriptions.description: Indicates the Initial/First payment with a payment_source that is intended to be stored upon successful processing of the payment.
Indicates a payment using a stored payment_source which has been successfully used previously for a payment.
Indicates that PayPal will derive the value of `FIRST` or `SUBSEQUENT` based on data available to PayPal.

previous_network_transaction_reference.title: Network Transaction Reference
previous_network_transaction_reference.description: Reference values used by the card network to identify a transaction.

allOf.title: Network Transaction
allOf.description: Reference values used by the card network to identify a transaction.

id.description: Transaction reference id returned by the scheme. For Visa and Amex, this is the "Tran id" field in response. For MasterCard, this is the "BankNet reference id" field in response. For Discover, this is the "NRID" field in response. The pattern we expect for this field from Visa/Amex/CB/Discover is numeric, Mastercard/BNPP is alphanumeric and Paysecure is alphanumeric with special character -.

date.description: The date that the transaction was authorized by the scheme. This field may not be returned for all networks. MasterCard refers to this field as "BankNet reference date.

network.title: Card Brand
network.description: The card network or brand. Applies to credit, debit, gift, and payment cards.

x-enumDescriptions.description: The Diners Club International banking and payment services capability network owned by Discover Financial Services (DFS), one of the most recognized brands in US financial services.
The Brazilian Elo card payment network.
The Brazilian Hipercard payment network that's widely accepted in the retail market.
The GE Credit Union 3Point card payment network.
The Electronic Fund Transfer At Point of Sale(EFTPOS) Debit card payment network.

acquirer_reference_number.description: Reference ID issued for the card transaction. This ID can be used to track the transaction across processors, card brands and issuing banks.

network_token.title: Network Token
network_token.description: The Third Party Network token used to fund a payment.

expiry.description: The year and month, in ISO-8601 `YYYY-MM` date format. See [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

cryptogram.description: An Encrypted one-time use value that's sent along with Network Token. This field is not required to be present for recurring transactions.

eci_flag.description: Electronic Commerce Indicator (ECI). The ECI value is part of the 2 data elements that indicate the transaction was processed electronically. This should be passed on the authorization transaction to the Gateway/Processor.

x-enumDescriptions.description: VISA, AMEX, JCB, DINERS CLUB fully authenticated transaction.
VISA, AMEX, JCB, DINERS CLUB attempted authentication transaction.
VISA, AMEX, JCB, DINERS CLUB non-3-D Secure transaction.

token_requestor_id.description: A TRID, or a Token Requestor ID, is an identifier used by merchants to request network tokens from card networks. A TRID is a precursor to obtaining a network token for a credit card primary account number (PAN), and will aid in enabling secure card on file (COF) payments and reducing fraud.

experience_context.title: Card Experience Context
experience_context.description: Customizes the payer experience during the 3DS Approval for payment.

token.title: Token
token.description: The tokenized payment source to fund a payment.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the token.

type.description: The tokenization method that generated the ID.

x-enumDescriptions.description: The PayPal billing agreement ID. References an approved recurring payment for goods or services.

paypal.title: PayPal Wallet
paypal.description: A resource that identifies a PayPal Wallet is used for payment.

vault_id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the vaulted payment source. This ID should be stored on the merchant's server so the saved payment source can be used for future transactions.

email_address.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.

given_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.

surname.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.

phone_number.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).
phone_number.title: Phone

national_number.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

birth_date.description: The stand-alone date, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). To represent special legal values, such as a date of birth, you should use dates with no associated time or time-zone data. Whenever possible, use the standard `date_time` type. This regular expression does not validate all dates. For example, February 31 is valid and nothing is known about leap years.

tax_info.description: The tax ID of the customer. The customer is also known as the payer. Both `tax_id` and `tax_id_type` are required.
tax_info.title: Tax Info

x-enumDescriptions.description: The individual tax ID type, typically is 11 characters long.
The business tax ID type, typically is 14 characters long.

address.description: The portable international postal address. Maps to [AddressValidationMetadata](https://github.com/googlei18n/libaddressinput/wiki/AddressValidationMetadata) and HTML 5.1 [Autofilling form controls: the autocomplete attribute](https://www.w3.org/TR/html51/sec-forms.html#autofilling-form-controls-the-autocomplete-attribute).
address.title: Portable Postal Address (Medium-Grained)

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address, such as number and street, for example, `173 Drury Lane`. Needed for data entry, and Compliance and Risk checks. This field needs to pass the full address.

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address, for example, a suite or apartment number.

admin_area_2.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than `admin_area_level_1`.

admin_area_1.description:
The highest-level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision. This data is formatted for postal delivery, for example, `CA` and not `California`. Value, by country, is:
  • UK. A county.
  • US. A state.
  • Canada. A province.
  • Japan. A prefecture.
  • Switzerland. A *kanton*.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the ZIP code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

country_code.description:
The [2-character ISO 3166-1 code](/api/rest/reference/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

attributes.title: PayPal Wallet Attributes
attributes.description: Additional attributes associated with the use of this PayPal Wallet.

customer.title: PayPal Wallet Customer Information
customer.description: The details about a customer in PayPal's system of record.

allOf.title: Customer Information
allOf.description: This object represents a merchants customer, allowing them to store contact details, and track all payments associated with the same customer.

id.description: The unique ID for a customer generated by PayPal.

email_address.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.

phone_number.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).
phone_number.title: Phone

national_number.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

given_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.

surname.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.

merchant_customer_id.description: Merchants and partners may already have a data-store where their customer information is persisted. Use merchant_customer_id to associate the PayPal-generated customer.id to your representation of a customer.

allOf.title: Vault Instruction Base
allOf.description: Basic vault instruction specification that can be extended by specific payment sources that supports vaulting.

store_in_vault.description: Defines how and when the payment source gets vaulted.

x-enumDescriptions.description: Defines that the payment_source will be vaulted only when at least one authorization or capture using that payment_source is successful.

description.description: The description displayed to PayPal consumer on the approval flow for PayPal, as well as on the PayPal payment token management experience on PayPal.com.

usage_pattern.title: PayPal Payment Token Usage Pattern
usage_pattern.description: Expected business/pricing model for the billing agreement.

x-enumDescriptions.description: On-demand instant payments  non-recurring, pre-paid, variable amount, variable frequency.
Pay after use, non-recurring post-paid, variable amount, irregular frequency.
Pay upfront fixed or variable amount on a fixed date before the goods/service is delivered.
Pay on a fixed date based on usage or consumption after the goods/service is delivered.
Charge payer when the set amount is reached or monthly billing cycle, whichever comes first, before the goods/service is delivered.
Charge payer when the set amount is reached or monthly billing cycle, whichever comes first, after the goods/service is delivered.
Subscription plan where the "amount due" and the "billing frequency" are fixed, and there is no defined duration with the payment due before the good/service is delivered.
Subscription plan where the "amount due" and the "billing frequency" are fixed, and there is no defined duration with the payment due after the goods/services are delivered.
Unscheduled card on file plan where the merchant can bill buyer upfront based on an agreed logic, but "amount due" and "frequency" can vary. Inclusive of automatic reload plans.
Unscheduled card on file plan where the merchant can bill buyer based on an agreed logic, but "amount due" and "frequency" can vary. Inclusive of automatic reload plans.

Merchant-managed installment plan when the "amount" to be paid and the "billing frequency" are fixed, but there is a defined number of payments with the payment due before the good/service is delivered.

Merchant-managed installment plan when the "amount" to be paid and the "billing frequency" are fixed, but there is a defined number of payments with the payment due after the goods/services are delivered.

usage_type.title: PayPal Payment Token Usage Type
usage_type.description: The usage type associated with the PayPal payment token.

x-enumDescriptions.description: The PayPal Payment Token will be used for future transaction directly with a merchant.
The PayPal Payment Token will be used for future transaction on a platform. A platform is typically a marketplace or a channel that a payer can purchase goods and services from multiple merchants.

customer_type.title: PayPal Payment Token Customer Type
customer_type.description: The customer type associated with the PayPal payment token. This is to indicate whether the customer acting on the merchant / platform is either a business or a consumer.

x-enumDescriptions.description: The customer vaulting the PayPal payment token is a consumer on the merchant / platform.
The customer vaulting the PayPal payment token is a business on merchant / platform.

permit_multiple_payment_tokens.description: Create multiple payment tokens for the same payer, merchant/platform combination. Use this when the customer has not logged in at merchant/platform. The payment token thus generated, can then also be used to create the customer account at merchant/platform. Use this also when multiple payment tokens are required for the same payer, different customer at merchant/platform. This helps to identify customers distinctly even though they may share the same PayPal account. This only applies to PayPal payment source.

allOf.title: Vaulted PayPal Wallet Common Attributes
allOf.description: Resource consolidating common request and response attributes for vaulting PayPal Wallet.
Attributes used to provide the instructions during vaulting of the PayPal Wallet.

experience_context.title: PayPal Wallet Experience Context
experience_context.description:
Customizes the payer experience during the approval process for payment with PayPal.
Note: Partners and Marketplaces might configure brand_name and shipping_preference during partner account setup, which overrides the request values.

brand_name.description: The label that overrides the business name in the PayPal account on the PayPal site. The pattern is defined by an external party and supports Unicode.

locale.description: The [language tag](https://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47#section-2) for the language in which to localize the error-related strings, such as messages, issues, and suggested actions. The tag is made up of the [ISO 639-2 language code](https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/code_list.php), the optional [ISO-15924 script tag](https://www.unicode.org/iso15924/codelists.html), and the [ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code](/api/rest/reference/country-codes/) or [M49 region code](https://unstats.un.org/unsd/methodology/m49/).

shipping_preference.description: The location from which the shipping address is derived.

x-enumDescriptions.description: Get the customer-provided shipping address on the PayPal site.

Removes the shipping address information from the API response and the Paypal site. However, the shipping.phone_number and shipping.email_address fields will still be returned to allow for digital goods delivery.
Get the merchant-provided address. The customer cannot change this address on the PayPal site. If merchant does not pass an address, customer can choose the address on PayPal pages.

contact_preference.description: The preference to display the contact information (buyers shipping email & phone number) on PayPal's checkout for easy merchant-buyer communication.

x-enumDescriptions.description: The merchant can opt out of showing buyer's contact information on PayPal checkout.

The merchant allows buyer to add or update shipping contact information on the PayPal checkout. Please ensure to use this updated information returned in shipping.email_address and shipping.phone_number to contact your buyers.

The buyer can only see but can not override merchant passed contact information (shipping.email_address and shipping.phone_number) on PayPal checkout. NOTE: If you don't pass the contact information, the behavior is the same as NO_CONTACT_INFO preference.

landing_page.description: The type of landing page to show on the PayPal site for customer checkout.

x-enumDescriptions.description: When the customer clicks PayPal Checkout, the customer is redirected to a page to log in to PayPal and approve the payment.

When the customer clicks PayPal Checkout, the customer is redirected to a page to enter credit or debit card and other relevant billing information required to complete the purchase. This option has previously been also called as 'BILLING'

When the customer clicks PayPal Checkout, the customer is redirected to either a page to log in to PayPal and approve the payment or to a page to enter credit or debit card and other relevant billing information required to complete the purchase, depending on their previous interaction with PayPal.

user_action.description: Configures a Continue or Pay Now checkout flow.

x-enumDescriptions.description: After you redirect the customer to the PayPal payment page, a Continue button appears. Use this option when the final amount is not known when the checkout flow is initiated and you want to redirect the customer to the merchant page without processing the payment.

After you redirect the customer to the PayPal payment page, a Pay Now button appears. Use this option when the final amount is known when the checkout is initiated and you want to process the payment immediately when the customer clicks Pay Now.
Accepts any type of payment from the customer.
Accepts only immediate payment from the customer. For example, credit card, PayPal balance, or instant ACH. Ensures that at the time of capture, the payment does not have the `pending` status.

order_update_callback_config.title: CallBack Configuration that the merchant can provide to PayPal/Venmo.
order_update_callback_config.description: CallBack Configuration that the merchant can provide to PayPal/Venmo.

callback_events.description: An array of callback events merchant can subscribe to for the corresponding callback url.

x-enumDescriptions.description: When Buyer changes or selects the shipping address on the PayPal/Venmo buyer approval flow , PayPal/Venmo will call merchant with the callback URL to update order totals.
When Buyer changes or selects the shipping options on the PayPal/Venmo buyer approval flow , PayPal/Venmo will call merchant with the callback URL to update order totals.

callback_url.description: Merchant provided CallBack url.PayPal/Venmo will use this url to call the merchant back when the events occur .PayPal/Venmo expects a secured url usually in the https format.merchant can append the cart id or other params part of the url as query or path params.

cryptogram.description: Online payment cryptogram, as defined by 3D Secure. The pattern is defined by an external party and supports Unicode.

eci_indicator.description: ECI indicator, as defined by 3- Secure. The pattern is defined by an external party and supports Unicode.

emv_data.description: Encoded Apple Pay EMV Payment Structure used for payments in China. The pattern is defined by an external party and supports Unicode.

pin.description: Bank Key encrypted Apple Pay PIN. The pattern is defined by an external party and supports Unicode.

stored_credential.title: Card Stored Credential
stored_credential.description:
Provides additional details to process a payment using a `card` that has been stored or is intended to be stored (also referred to as stored_credential or card-on-file).
Parameter compatibility:
  • `payment_type=ONE_TIME` is compatible only with `payment_initiator=CUSTOMER`.
  • `usage=FIRST` is compatible only with `payment_initiator=CUSTOMER`.
  • `previous_transaction_reference` or `previous_network_transaction_reference` is compatible only with `payment_initiator=MERCHANT`.
  • Only one of the parameters - `previous_transaction_reference` and `previous_network_transaction_reference` - can be present in the request.

admin_area_1.description:
The highest-level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision. This data is formatted for postal delivery, for example, `CA` and not `California`. Value, by country, is:
  • UK. A county.
  • US. A state.
  • Canada. A province.
  • Japan. A prefecture.
  • Switzerland. A *kanton*.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the ZIP code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

country_code.description:
The [2-character ISO 3166-1 code](/api/rest/reference/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

decrypted_token.title: Google Pay payment request object
decrypted_token.description: Details shared by Google for the merchant to be shared with PayPal. This is required to process the transaction using the Google Pay payment method.

message_id.description: A unique ID that identifies the message in case it needs to be revoked or located at a later time.

message_expiration.description: Date and time at which the message expires as UTC milliseconds since epoch. Integrators should reject any message that's expired.

payment_method.description: The type of the payment credential. Currently, only CARD is supported.

x-enumDescriptions.description: CARD is the only value that Google Pay accepts.

card.description: The payment card used to fund a Google Pay payment. Can be a credit or debit card.
card.title: Google Pay Card

name.description: The card holder's name as it appears on the card.

number.description: The primary account number (PAN) for the payment card.

expiry.description: The year and month, in ISO-8601 `YYYY-MM` date format. See [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

last_digits.description: The last digits of the payment card.

type.title: Card Type
type.description: Type of card. i.e Credit, Debit and so on.

brand.title: Card Brand
brand.description: The card network or brand. Applies to credit, debit, gift, and payment cards.

x-enumDescriptions.description: The Diners Club International banking and payment services capability network owned by Discover Financial Services (DFS), one of the most recognized brands in US financial services.
The Brazilian Elo card payment network.
The Brazilian Hipercard payment network that's widely accepted in the retail market.
The GE Credit Union 3Point card payment network.
The Electronic Fund Transfer At Point of Sale(EFTPOS) Debit card payment network.

billing_address.description: The portable international postal address. Maps to [AddressValidationMetadata](https://github.com/googlei18n/libaddressinput/wiki/AddressValidationMetadata) and HTML 5.1 [Autofilling form controls: the autocomplete attribute](https://www.w3.org/TR/html51/sec-forms.html#autofilling-form-controls-the-autocomplete-attribute).
billing_address.title: Portable Postal Address (Medium-Grained)

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address, such as number and street, for example, `173 Drury Lane`. Needed for data entry, and Compliance and Risk checks. This field needs to pass the full address.

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address, for example, a suite or apartment number.

admin_area_2.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than `admin_area_level_1`.

admin_area_1.description:
The highest-level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision. This data is formatted for postal delivery, for example, `CA` and not `California`. Value, by country, is:
  • UK. A county.
  • US. A state.
  • Canada. A province.
  • Japan. A prefecture.
  • Switzerland. A *kanton*.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the ZIP code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

country_code.description:
The [2-character ISO 3166-1 code](/api/rest/reference/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.
Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

authentication_method.description: Authentication Method which is used for the card transaction.

x-enumDescriptions.description: This authentication method is associated with payment cards stored on file with the user's Google Account. Returned payment data includes primary account number (PAN) with the expiration month and the expiration year.

Returned payment data includes a 3-D Secure (3DS) cryptogram generated on the device. -> If authentication_method=CRYPTOGRAM, it is required that 'cryptogram' parameter in the request has a valid 3-D Secure (3DS) cryptogram generated on the device.

cryptogram.description: Base-64 cryptographic identifier used by card schemes to validate the token verification result. This is a conditionally required field if authentication_method is CRYPTOGRAM_3DS.

eci_indicator.description: Electronic Commerce Indicator may not always be present. It is only returned for tokens on the Visa card network. This value is passed through in the payment authorization request.

assurance_details.title: Assurance Details
assurance_details.description: Information about cardholder possession validation and cardholder identification and verifications (ID&V).

account_verified.description: If true, indicates that Cardholder possession validation has been performed on returned payment credential.

card_holder_authenticated.description: If true, indicates that identification and verifications (ID&V) was performed on the returned payment credential.If false, the same risk-based authentication can be performed as you would for card transactions. This risk-based authentication can include, but not limited to, step-up with 3D Secure protocol if applicable.

experience_context.title: Google Pay Experience Context
experience_context.description: Customizes the payer experience during the approval process for the payment.

venmo.title: Venmo Wallet Request
venmo.description: Information needed to pay using Venmo.

vault_id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the vaulted payment source. This ID should be stored on the merchant's server so the saved payment source can be used for future transactions.

email_address.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.

experience_context.title: Venmo Wallet Experience Context
experience_context.description:
Customizes the buyer experience during the approval process for payment with Venmo.
Note: Partners and Marketplaces might configure shipping_preference during partner account setup, which overrides the request values.

brand_name.description: The business name of the merchant. The pattern is defined by an external party and supports Unicode.

shipping_preference.description: The location from which the shipping address is derived.

x-enumDescriptions.description: Get the customer-provided shipping address on the PayPal site.
Redacts the shipping address from the PayPal site. Recommended for digital goods.
Get the merchant-provided address. The customer cannot change this address on the PayPal site. If merchant does not pass an address, customer can choose the address on PayPal pages.

order_update_callback_config.title: CallBack Configuration that the merchant can provide to PayPal/Venmo.
order_update_callback_config.description: CallBack Configuration that the merchant can provide to PayPal/Venmo.

callback_events.description: An array of callback events merchant can subscribe to for the corresponding callback url.

x-enumDescriptions.description: When Buyer changes or selects the shipping address on the PayPal/Venmo buyer approval flow , PayPal/Venmo will call merchant with the callback URL to update order totals.
When Buyer changes or selects the shipping options on the PayPal/Venmo buyer approval flow , PayPal/Venmo will call merchant with the callback URL to update order totals.

callback_url.description: Merchant provided CallBack url.PayPal/Venmo will use this url to call the merchant back when the events occur .PayPal/Venmo expects a secured url usually in the https format.merchant can append the cart id or other params part of the url as query or path params.

attributes.title: Venmo Wallet Attributes
attributes.description: Additional attributes associated with the use of this Venmo Wallet.

customer.title: Customer Information
customer.description: This object represents a merchants customer, allowing them to store contact details, and track all payments associated with the same customer.

id.description: The unique ID for a customer generated by PayPal.

email_address.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.

phone_number.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).
phone_number.title: Phone

national_number.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

given_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.

surname.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.

vault.title: Vaulted Venmo Wallet Common Attributes
vault.description: Resource consolidating common request and response attirbutes for vaulting Venmo Wallet.

allOf.title: Base Vault Instruction Parameters
allOf.description: Base vaulting specification. The object can be extended for specific use cases within each payment_source that supports vaulting.

store_in_vault.description: Defines how and when the payment source gets vaulted.

x-enumDescriptions.description: Defines that the payment_source will be vaulted only when at least one authorization or capture using that payment_source is successful.

description.description: The description displayed to Venmo consumer on the approval flow for Venmo, as well as on the Venmo payment token management experience on Venmo.com.

usage_pattern.title: Venmo Payment Token Usage Pattern
usage_pattern.description: Expected business/pricing model for the billing agreement.

x-enumDescriptions.description: On-demand instant payments  non-recurring, pre-paid, variable amount, variable frequency.
Pay after use, non-recurring post-paid, variable amount, irregular frequency.
Pay upfront fixed or variable amount on a fixed date before the goods/service is delivered.
Pay on a fixed date based on usage or consumption after the goods/service is delivered.
Charge payer when the set amount is reached or monthly billing cycle, whichever comes first, before the goods/service is delivered.
Charge payer when the set amount is reached or monthly billing cycle, whichever comes first, after the goods/service is delivered.

usage_type.title: Venmo Payment Token Usage Type
usage_type.description: The usage type associated with the Venmo payment token.

x-enumDescriptions.description: The Venmo Payment Token will be used for future transaction directly with a merchant.
The Venmo Payment Token will be used for future transaction on a platform. A platform is typically a marketplace or a channel that a payer can purchase goods and services from multiple merchants.

customer_type.title: Venmo Payment Token Customer Type
customer_type.description: The customer type associated with the Venmo payment token. This is to indicate whether the customer acting on the merchant / platform is either a business or a consumer.

x-enumDescriptions.description: The customer vaulting the Venmo payment token is a consumer on the merchant / platform.
The customer vaulting the Venmo payment token is a business on merchant / platform.

permit_multiple_payment_tokens.description: Create multiple payment tokens for the same payer, merchant/platform combination. Use this when the customer has not logged in at merchant/platform. The payment token thus generated, can then also be used to create the customer account at merchant/platform. Use this also when multiple payment tokens are required for the same payer, different customer at merchant/platform. This helps to identify customers distinctly even though they may share the same Venmo account.

name: capture_order

additional_recipients.description: An array of one or more CC: emails to which notifications are sent

name: cancel_invoice
description: Cancels a sent invoice, by ID, and, optionally, sends a notification about the cancellation to the payer, merchant, and CC: emails. Only sent invoices can be canceled.

invoice_id.description: The ID of the invoice to cancel (e.g., 'INV2-RF6D-L66T-D7H2-CRU7')

subject.description: The subject of the email that is sent as a notification to the recipient

note.description: A note to the payer explaining the cancellation

send_to_invoicer.description: Indicates whether to send a copy of the email to the merchant

send_to_recipient.description: Indicates whether to send a copy of the email to the recipient

additional_recipients.description: An array of one or more CC: emails to which notifications are sent

name: record_payment
description: Records a payment for the invoice. If no payment is due, the invoice is marked as PAID. Otherwise, the invoice is marked as PARTIALLY PAID. The API will generate a payment_id automatically.

invoice_id.description: The ID of the invoice to mark as paid (e.g., 'INV2-RF6D-L66T-D7H2-CRU7')

payment_id.description: The ID for a PayPal payment transaction. Required for the PAYPAL payment type, optional for other payment types

note.description: A note associated with an external cash or check payment

payment_date.description: The payment date in YYYY-MM-DD format

value.description: The payment amount value

shipping_info.description: The contact information of the user. Includes name and address.

name: delete_invoice_payment
description: Deletes an external payment, by invoice ID and transaction ID.

transaction_id.description: The ID of the external payment transaction to delete.

name: record_invoice_refund
description: Records a refund for the invoice. If all payments are refunded, the invoice is marked as REFUNDED. Otherwise, the invoice is marked as PARTIALLY REFUNDED.

invoice_id.description: The ID of the invoice to mark as refunded (e.g., 'INV2-RF6D-L66T-D7H2-CRU7')

refund_date.description: The refund date in YYYY-MM-DD format. If not provided, defaults to current date.

amount.description: The currency and amount for the refund

value.description: The refund amount value

method.description: The payment mode or method through which the invoicer can accept the payments

name: delete_external_refund
description: Deletes a refund that was recorded against an invoice

transaction_id.description: The ID of the refund transaction to delete

name: generate_invoice_qr_code
description: Generates a QR code for an invoice, by ID. The QR code is a PNG image in Base64-encoded format that corresponds to the invoice ID.

width.description: The width, in pixels, of the QR code image. Value is from 150 to 500.

height.description: The height, in pixels, of the QR code image. Value is from 150 to 500.

action.description: The type of URL for which to generate a QR code. Valid values are 'pay' and 'details'.

name: search_invoices
description: Searches for and lists invoices that match search criteria. If you pass multiple criteria, the response lists invoices that match all criteria.

recipient_email.description: Filters the search by the email address.

recipient_first_name.description: Filters the search by the recipient first name.

recipient_last_name.description: Filters the search by the recipient last name.

recipient_business_name.description: Filters the search by the recipient business name.

invoice_number.description: Filters the search by the invoice number.

status.description: An array of status values (max 5 items).

reference.description: The reference data, such as a PO number.

memo.description: A private bookkeeping memo for the user.

payment_date_range.description: The date and time range. Filters invoices by payment date.

start.description: The date and time, in Internet date and time format. Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.

end.description: The date and time, in Internet date and time format. Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.

archived.description: Indicates whether to list merchant-archived invoices in the response. Value is true (archived only), false (unarchived only), or null (all invoices).

fields.description: A CSV file of fields to return for the user, if available. Valid collection fields are items, payments, refunds, additional_recipients_info, and attachments.

currency_code.description: The three-character ISO-4217 currency code that identifies the currency.

lower_amount.description: The currency and amount for a financial transaction.

value.description: The value, which might be an integer for currencies like JPY or a decimal fraction for currencies like TND.

upper_amount.description: The currency and amount for a financial transaction.

value.description: The value, which might be an integer for currencies like JPY or a decimal fraction for currencies like TND.

invoice_date_range.description: The date range. Filters invoices by invoice date.

start.description: The stand-alone date, in Internet date and time format (YYYY-MM-DD).

end.description: The stand-alone date, in Internet date and time format (YYYY-MM-DD).

due_date_range.description: The date range. Filters invoices by due date.

start.description: The stand-alone date, in Internet date and time format (YYYY-MM-DD).

end.description: The stand-alone date, in Internet date and time format (YYYY-MM-DD).

creation_date_range.description: The date and time range. Filters invoices by creation date.

start.description: The date and time, in Internet date and time format. Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.

end.description: The date and time, in Internet date and time format. Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.

page.description: The page number to be retrieved, for the list of items. So, a combination of page=1 and page_size=20 returns the first 20 invoices.

page_size.description: The page size for the search results.

total_required.description: Indicates whether to show total_pages and total_items in the response.

name: create_invoice_template
description: Create an invoice template. You can use details from this template to create invoices. You can create up to 50 templates per merchant.

name.description: The template name. Must be unique for the merchant.

default_template.description: Indicates whether this template is the default template. A invoicer can have one default template.

template_info.description: The template information which is reused for the invoices created from this template.

reference.description: The reference data. Includes a post office (PO) number.

currency_code.description: The three-character ISO-4217 currency code that identifies the currency.

note.description: A note to the invoice recipient. Also appears on the invoice notification email.

terms_and_conditions.description: The general terms of the invoice. Can include return or cancellation policy and other terms and conditions.

memo.description: A private bookkeeping memo for the user.

attachments.description: An array of PayPal IDs for the files that are attached to an invoice.

id.description: The ID of the referenced file.

payment_term.description: The payment term of the invoice. Payment can be due upon receipt, a specified date, or in a set number of days.

term_type.description: The payment term. Payment can be due upon receipt, a specified date, or in a set number of days.

invoicer.description: The invoicer information. Includes the business name, email, address, phone, fax, tax ID, additional notes, and logo URL.

given_name.description: The party's given, or first, name.

surname.description: The party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name.

phones.description: An array of invoicer's phone numbers. The invoicer can have a maximum of two phone numbers.

country_code.description: The country calling code (CC), in its canonical international E.164 numbering plan format.

national_number.description: The national number, in its canonical international E.164 numbering plan format.

address_line_1.description: The first line of the address. For example, number, street, and so on.

address_line_2.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.

address_line_3.description: The third line of the address, if needed. For example, a street complement.

admin_area_4.description: The neighborhood, ward, or district. Smaller than admin_area_level_3 or sub_locality.

admin_area_3.description: A sub-locality, suburb, neighborhood, or district. Smaller than admin_area_level_2.

admin_area_2.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than admin_area_level_1.

admin_area_1.description: The highest level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent.

country_code.description: The two-character ISO 3166-1 code that identifies the country or region.

logo_url.description: The full URL to an external logo image. The logo image must not be larger than 250 pixels wide by 90 pixels high.

additional_notes.description: Any additional information. Includes business hours.

primary_recipients.description: The billing and shipping information. Includes name, email, address, phone and language. Maximum 100 recipients.

billing_info.description: The billing information for the invoice recipient.

business_name.description: The business name of the party.

prefix.description: The prefix, or title, to the party's name.

middle_name.description: The middle name of the party.

suffix.description: The suffix for the party's name.

alternate_full_name.description: An alternate name of the party, such as a business name or nickname.

additional_info.description: The additional information about the party. Maximum length: 40.

language.description: The language in which to show the invoice recipient's email message. Used only when the recipient does not have a PayPal account.

shipping_info.description: The shipping information for the invoice recipient.

business_name.description: The business name of the party.

prefix.description: The prefix, or title, to the party's name.

middle_name.description: The middle name of the party.

suffix.description: The suffix for the party's name.

alternate_full_name.description: An alternate name of the party.

additional_recipients.description: An array of one or more CC: emails to which notifications are sent. If you omit this parameter, a notification is sent to all CC: email addresses that are part of the invoice. Maximum 100 recipients.

items.description: An array of invoice line item information.

quantity.description: The quantity of the item that the invoicer provides to the payer. Value is from -1000000 to 1000000. Supports up to five decimal places.

unit_amount.description: The unit price of the item. This does not include tax and discount.

currency_code.description: The three-character ISO-4217 currency code that identifies the currency.

value.description: The value, which might be an integer for currencies like JPY that are not typically fractional or a decimal fraction for currencies like USD.

tax.description: The item tax. A negative value is a discount.

percent.description: The tax rate. Value is from 0 to 100. Supports up to five decimal places.

tax_note.description: The tax note used to track the tax related data.

discount.description: The item discount. A negative value is a surcharge.

percent.description: The discount as a percentage value. Value is from 0 to 100. Supports up to five decimal places.

item_date.description: The date when the item or service was provided, in Internet date format (YYYY-MM-DD).

unit_of_measure.description: The unit of measure for the invoiced item. For AMOUNT the unit_amount must be a currency value, and quantity must be one.

configuration.description: The invoice configuration details. Includes partial payment, tip, and tax calculated after discount.

partial_payment.description: The partial payment details. Includes the minimum amount that the invoicer wants the payer to pay.

allow_partial_payment.description: Indicates whether the invoice allows a partial payment. If False, invoice must be paid in full. If True, the invoice allows partial payments.

minimum_amount_due.description: The minimum amount allowed for a partial payment.

allow_tip.description: Indicates whether the invoice enables the customer to enter a tip amount during payment. If True, the invoice shows a tip amount field so that the customer can enter a tip amount. If False, the invoice does not show a tip amount field.

tax_calculated_after_discount.description: Indicates whether the tax is calculated before or after a discount. If False, the tax is calculated before a discount. If True, the tax is calculated after a discount.

tax_inclusive.description: Indicates whether the unit price includes tax. If False, the unit price does not include tax. If True, the unit price includes tax.

amount.description: The invoice amount summary of item total, discount, tax total and shipping.

breakdown.description: The breakdown of the amount. Includes item total, discount, tax total and shipping amounts.

custom.description: The custom amount to apply to an invoice. If you include a label, you must include a custom amount.

shipping.description: The shipping fee for all items. Includes tax on shipping.

discount.description: The discount as a percent or amount at invoice level. The invoice discount amount is subtracted from the item total.

template_item_settings.description: The template level item settings. Enables you to hide item columns on the invoice.

field_name.description: The field name for the template item setting.

display_preference.description: The display preference for the field.

hidden.description: Indicates whether the field is hidden. Value is True if the field is hidden.

template_subtotal_settings.description: The template level subtotal settings. Enables you to hide subtotal related fields on the invoice.

field_name.description: The field name for the template subtotal setting.

display_preference.description: The display preference for the field.

hidden.description: Indicates whether the field is hidden. Value is True if the field is hidden.

unit_of_measure.description: The unit of measure for the template. This unit of measure is applied to the invoice item quantity.

name: list_invoice_templates
description: Lists merchant-created invoice templates with associated details including emails, addresses, and phone numbers from the user's PayPal profile. The user can select which values to show in the business information section of their template.

page.description: The page number to be retrieved, for the list of templates. So, a combination of page=1 and page_size=20 returns the first 20 templates.

page_size.description: The maximum number of templates to return in the response.

fields.description: The fields to return in the response. Value is 'all' to return complete details or 'none' to return only the template name, ID, and default attributes.

name: get_invoice_template
description: Get invoice template details by ID. Shows complete details for a specific invoice template.

template_id.description: The ID of the template to retrieve

name: update_invoice_template
description: Update an invoice template. Performs a full replacement of the template data (not partial update).

template_id.description: The ID of the template to update

default_template.description: Whether this is the default template

template_info.description: Template details including invoicer, recipients, items, and configuration

note.description: A note to the invoice recipient

terms_and_conditions.description: The general terms of the invoice

percent.description: The tax rate (must be non-negative percentage)

unit_of_measure.description: Unit of measure for the template

name: delete_invoice_template
description: Delete an invoice template by ID. Returns no content on success.

template_id.description: The ID of the template to delete

name: list_transactions
description: Lists transactions. Specify one or more query parameters to filter the transactions that appear in the response. Note: If you specify optional query parameters, ending_balance field is empty. It takes up to 3 hours for executed transactions to appear. Lists transactions for previous 3 years. Max date range is 31 days.

start_date.description: Filters transactions by start date and time, in Internet date and time format. Seconds are required. Fractional seconds are optional.

end_date.description: Filters transactions by end date and time, in Internet date and time format. Seconds are required. The maximum supported range is 31 days.

transaction_id.description: Filters by PayPal transaction ID. Valid ID is 17 characters (19 for order ID). Note: Transaction ID may not be unique - can list multiple transactions with same ID.

transaction_type.description: Filters by PayPal transaction event code (e.g., T0000-T9999). See Transaction event codes documentation.

transaction_status.description: Filters by status code. D=PayPal or user rules denied. P=Pending, awaiting another payment process. S=Successfully completed. V=Successful transaction reversed and refunded.

transaction_amount.description: Filters by gross transaction amount range. Format: '<start> TO <end>' in lower denominations (e.g., '500 TO 1005' for $5.00 to $10.05). Values must be URL encoded.

transaction_currency.description: Filters by three-character ISO-4217 currency code for the PayPal transaction currency.

payment_instrument_type.description: Filters by payment instrument type. CREDITCARD returns direct credit card transactions. DEBITCARD returns debit card transactions.

store_id.description: Filters the transactions in the response by a store ID.

terminal_id.description: Filters the transactions in the response by a terminal ID.

fields.description: Indicates which fields appear in the response. Value is single field or comma-separated list. Use 'all' for all fields. Default is 'transaction_info'. Valid: transaction_info, payer_info, shipping_info, auction_info, cart_info, incentive_info, store_info.

balance_affecting_records_only.description: Indicates response includes only balance-impacting transactions (Y) or all transactions (N). Default is Y.

page_size.description: Number of items to return in the response. For example, page=1 and page_size=20 returns first 20 items.

page.description: The zero-relative start index of entire list of items returned in response. page=1 and page_size=20 returns first 20 items.

name: list_balances
description: List all balances. Specify date time to list balances for that time that appear in the response. It takes a maximum of three hours for balances to appear in the list balances call. This call lists balances up to the previous three years.

as_of_time.description: List balances in the response at the date time provided, will return the last refreshed balance in the system when not provided.

currency_code.description: Filters the balances in the response by a three-character ISO-4217 currency code for the PayPal transaction currency.

include_crypto_currencies.description: Include cryptocurrency balances in the response. Defaults to false.

name: add_shipping_tracker
description: Adds tracking information for one or more PayPal transactions. Accepts an array of tracker objects.

trackers.description: An array of tracking information objects to add

tracking_number.description: The tracking number for the shipment. This property supports only ASCII characters and does not allow URL, phone number, or email formats. Carrier information (carrier) is required if a tracking number is provided.

carrier_name_other.description: The name of the carrier for the shipment. Provide this value only if the carrier parameter is OTHER.

notify_buyer.description: If true, sends an email notification to the buyer of the PayPal transaction. The email contains the tracking information that was uploaded through the API.

shipment_direction.description: To denote whether the shipment is sent forward to the receiver or returned back

fulfillment_provider.description: Indicates the fulfillment service used to deliver an order

status.description: The status of the item shipment. For allowed values, see Shipping Statuses.

shipment_date.description: The stand-alone date, in Internet date and time format. To represent special legal values, such as a date of birth, you should use dates with no associated time or time-zone data.

carrier.description: The carrier for the shipment. Carrier information is required when tracking_number is provided.

last_updated_time.description: The date and time, in Internet date and time format. Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.

name: list_shipping_trackers
description: Lists tracking information that meet search criteria. The tracking ID is required but the tracking number is optional. Returns tracking information for a specific PayPal transaction.

transaction_id.description: Filters the tracking information that appears in the response by a PayPal transaction ID

tracking_number.description: Filters the tracking information that appears in the response by a tracking number

account_id.description: Encrypted PayPal Account ID of the buyer or seller

name: update_shipping_tracker
description: Updates or cancels tracking information for a PayPal transaction by ID. To cancel tracking information, set the status to CANCELLED.

id.description: The ID of the tracker in the transaction_id-tracking_number format

transaction_id.description: The PayPal transaction ID (must match the one in URL)

tracking_number.description: The tracking number (must match the one in URL if provided)

status.description: The updated status of the item shipment. Set to CANCELLED to cancel tracking.

shipment_date.description: The updated date when the shipment occurred, in Internet date and time format

carrier.description: The updated carrier for the shipment

carrier_name_other.description: The name of the carrier if carrier is OTHER

notify_buyer.description: If true, sends email notification to buyer with tracking information

shipment_direction.description: The direction of the shipment (e.g., INBOUND, OUTBOUND)

tracking_url.description: The URL for tracking the shipment

fulfillment_provider.description: The fulfillment service used to deliver the order

last_updated_time.description: The last time the tracking information was updated

name: get_shipping_tracker
description: Show tracking information for a PayPal transaction. Retrieves details using tracker ID format {transaction_id}-{tracking_number} or {transaction_id}.

id.description: Tracker ID in format {transaction_id}-{tracking_number} or {transaction_id}

account_id.description: Encrypted PayPal Account ID of the buyer or seller

name: add_shipping_trackers_batch
description: Add tracking information for multiple PayPal transactions in a single batch. Supports up to 20 trackers per request. Matches PayPal Tracking API v1 specification.

trackers.description: Array of tracking information. Maximum 20 trackers per batch.

tracking_number.description: The tracking number for the shipment. Carrier information is required if tracking_number is provided.

status.description: The status of the item shipment. For allowed values, see Shipping Statuses.

shipment_date.description: The date when the shipment occurred, in Internet date and time format

carrier.description: The carrier for the shipment. Carrier information is required when tracking_number is provided.

carrier_name_other.description: The name of the carrier for the shipment. Provide this value only if the carrier parameter is OTHER.

notify_buyer.description: If true, sends an email notification to the buyer of the PayPal transaction. The email contains the tracking information that was uploaded through the API.

tracking_number_validated.description: Indicates whether the carrier validated the tracking number

shipment_direction.description: To denote whether the shipment is sent forward to the receiver or returned back

shipment_uploader.description: To denote which party uploaded the shipment tracking info

account_id.description: Encrypted PayPal Account ID of the buyer or seller

name: list_customer_disputes
description: List customer disputes with filtering and pagination. Retrieves disputes that may require user action. Reference: https://developer.paypal.com/docs/api/customer-disputes/v1/#disputes_list

start_time.description: Filters disputes created on or after this date (ISO 8601 format). Must be within the last 180 days. Cannot be used with disputed_transaction_id.

disputed_transaction_id.description: Filters disputes for a specific transaction ID. Cannot be used with start_time.

dispute_state.description: Filters disputes by state. Separate multiple values with a comma (,). Valid values: OPEN_INQUIRIES, REQUIRED_ACTION, REQUIRED_OTHER_PARTY_ACTION, UNDER_PAYPAL_REVIEW, APPEALABLE, RESOLVED

update_time_before.description: Filters disputes updated before this date (ISO 8601 format). Must be within the last 180 days.

update_time_after.description: Filters disputes updated after this date (ISO 8601 format). Must be within the last 180 days.

page_size.description: The number of disputes to return (1-50)

next_page_token.description: The token for the next page of results

name: get_customer_dispute
description: Show details for a dispute by ID. Returns complete dispute information including messages, evidence, and allowed response options. Reference: https://developer.paypal.com/docs/api/customer-disputes/v1/#disputes_get

dispute_id.description: The ID of the dispute for which to show details.

name: update_customer_dispute
description: Partially updates a dispute, by ID. Seller can update the communication_detail value or the partner can add the partner action information.

dispute_id.description: The ID of the dispute to update.

patch_operations.description: Array of JSON patch operations to apply to the dispute resource.

path.description: The JSON Pointer to the target document location at which to complete the operation.

value.description: The value to apply. The remove, copy, and move operations do not require a value. Since JSON Patch allows any type for value, the type property is not specified.

from.description: The JSON Pointer to the target document location from which to move the value. Required for the move and copy operations.

name: send_dispute_message
description: Sends a message about a dispute, by ID, to the other party in the dispute. Merchants and customers can only send messages if the dispute is in the INQUIRY stage.

dispute_id.description: The ID of the dispute for which to send a message.

message.description: The message sent by the merchant to the other party.

name: provide_dispute_evidence
description: Provides evidence for a dispute, by ID. A Software Partner can provide evidence for a dispute on behalf of a merchant. The Software Partner must have the correct permissions to access and provide evidence for the merchant.

inputSchema.title: ProvideEvidenceToolSchema
inputSchema.description: Input schema for the provide evidence tool

dispute_id.title: Dispute Id
dispute_id.description: The ID of the dispute for which to submit evidence.

evidences.title: Evidences
evidences.description: Array of evidence items for the dispute (optional, 0-100 items)

items.title: EvidenceItem
items.description: Single evidence item in the evidences array

evidence_type.title: Evidence Type
evidence_type.description: The evidence type - see PayPal documentation for complete list of valid values

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: An array of evidence documents. Each item should be an object with 'name' (required) and 'notes' (optional) fields

item_id.title: Item Id
item_id.description: The item ID. If the merchant provides multiple pieces of evidence and the transaction has multiple item IDs, the merchant can use this value to associate a piece of evidence with an item ID

return_shipping_address.title: Return Shipping Address
return_shipping_address.description: The return address for the item. Required when the customer must return an item to the merchant for the MERCHANDISE_OR_SERVICE_NOT_AS_DESCRIBED dispute reason.

address_line_1.title: Address Line 1
address_line_1.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street. For example, 173 Drury Lane. Required for data entry and compliance and risk checks. Must contain the full address.

address_line_2.title: Address Line 2
address_line_2.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.

address_line_3.title: Address Line 3
address_line_3.description: The third line of the address, if needed. For example, a street complement for Brazil, direction text, such as next to Walmart, or a landmark in an Indian address.

admin_area_4.title: Admin Area 4
admin_area_4.description: The neighborhood, ward, or district. Smaller than admin_area_level_3 or sub_locality.

admin_area_3.title: Admin Area 3
admin_area_3.description: A sub-locality, suburb, neighborhood, or district. Smaller than admin_area_level_2.

admin_area_2.title: Admin Area 2
admin_area_2.description: A city, town, or village. Smaller than admin_area_level_1.

admin_area_1.title: Admin Area 1
admin_area_1.description: The highest level sub-division in a country, which is usually a province, state, or ISO-3166-2 subdivision.

postal_code.title: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent.

country_code.title: Country Code
country_code.description: The two-character ISO 3166-1 code that identifies the country or region. Required.

address_details.title: Address Details
address_details.description: The non-portable additional address details that are sometimes needed for compliance, risk, or other scenarios where fine-grain address information might be needed.

name: provide_dispute_supporting_info
description: Provides supporting information for a dispute, by ID. A Software Partner can provide supporting information for a dispute on behalf of a merchant. The Software Partner must have the correct permissions to access and provide information for the merchant. This action is only available during CHARGEBACK, PRE_ARBITRATION, or ARBITRATION stages.

dispute_id.description: The ID of the dispute for which to provide supporting information.

notes.description: The notes associated with the dispute. Required field. Maximum length is 2000 characters.

file_name.description: Name of the supporting document file.

file_content.description: Base64 encoded file content for the supporting document.

name: update_dispute_lifecycle
description: Update a dispute's lifecycle stage for testing purposes. Use this to change a dispute to CHARGEBACK, PRE_ARBITRATION, or ARBITRATION before providing supporting info.

name: make_dispute_offer
description: Make a settlement offer to resolve a PayPal customer dispute. This can be used when the dispute_life_cycle_stage is INQUIRY to make various types of offers including refunds, returns, and replacements.

inputSchema.title: MakeOfferToolSchema
inputSchema.description: Input schema for the make offer tool - aligned with PayPal API nested structure

note.title: Note
note.description: Merchant's note explaining the offer (max 2000 characters)

offer_type.title: Offer Type
offer_type.description: Type of offer: REFUND, REFUND_WITH_RETURN, REFUND_WITH_REPLACEMENT, REPLACEMENT_WITHOUT_REFUND

offer_amount.title: Offer Amount
offer_amount.description: Amount offered for refund - required for REFUND offers

value.description: Refund amount with 2 decimal places

invoice_id.title: Invoice Id
invoice_id.description: Invoice ID associated with the offer

name: accept_dispute_offer
description: Accept a settlement offer to resolve a PayPal customer dispute. This can be used when the dispute_life_cycle_stage is INQUIRY to accept an offer made by the merchant. PayPal automatically refunds the amount proposed by merchant to the customer.

inputSchema.title: AcceptOfferToolSchema
inputSchema.description: Input schema for the accept offer tool

dispute_id.title: Dispute Id
dispute_id.description: The ID of the dispute to accept the offer for

note.title: Note
note.description: The notes about accepting the offer (optional, 1-2000 characters when provided)

name: deny_dispute_offer
description: Deny a settlement offer in a PayPal customer dispute. This can be used when the dispute_life_cycle_stage is INQUIRY to deny an offer made by the merchant. The dispute remains open for further negotiation or escalation.

inputSchema.title: DenyOfferToolSchema
inputSchema.description: Input schema for the deny offer tool

dispute_id.title: Dispute Id
dispute_id.description: The ID of the dispute for which to deny the offer

note.title: Note
note.description: The merchant's notes about the claim (required, 1-2000 characters)

name: escalate_dispute
description: Escalate a PayPal dispute from inquiry stage to claim (chargeback) stage. The dispute must be in INQUIRY stage to escalate.

inputSchema.title: EscalateToolSchema
inputSchema.description: Input schema for the escalate dispute tool

dispute_id.title: Dispute Id
